title: Chi-Squared Goodness of Fit Test
contentHtml:

subject: statistics
title: Chi-Squared Goodness of Fit Test
contentHtml:
The chi-squared goodness of fit test is a statistical technique used to determine whether a given distribution or pattern in data is consistent with a specified hypothesis.

This test is particularly useful when dealing with categorical data, and it's widely applied in machine learning and artificial intelligence.
name: Chi-Squared Statistic" },
problemHtml: Suppose we want to test whether the observed frequencies of different car colors are consistent with a uniform distribution.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Calculate the expected frequencies under the null hypothesis", "mathHtml": "\\[\\text{expected}_i = \\frac{\\text{total}}{k}\\]", "explanation": "We assume that all colors are equally likely"}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Calculate the chi-squared statistic", "mathHtml": "\\[\chi^2 = \\sum_{i=1}^k \\frac{(\\text{observed}_i - \\text{expected}_i)^2}{\\text{expected}_i}\\]", "explanation": "This measures the difference between observed and expected frequencies"} ],
intuition: The chi-squared test helps us determine whether our data deviates significantly from a specified distribution.
realWorldApplications: Testing the uniformity of user ratings in recommendation systems
